properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 8:37AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
Light, powdery snow could limit visibilities along roadways today.
A band of snow will drift from Cook Inlet over the Anchorage Bowl
this morning. Generally around 1-3" of snow is expected. Due to
the cold temperatures, the snow is expected to be a powdery
consistency. Powdery snow is very prone to becoming resuspended by
fast-moving vehicle traffic. This will locally reduce visibility,
especially along the Glenn and Seward Highways through this
evening. Conditions will improve overnight tonight as snow tapers
off. Drivers are urged to leave plenty of extra space between
vehicles and to use caution.

NWSheadline: LIGHT, POWDERY SNOW RETURNING TO ANCHORAGE
